questions.question: What is the purpose of the __init__ method in a Python class?
What will be the output of this code?
What does inheritance allow in object-oriented programming?
answers: Creating multiple instances of a class
A class to inherit properties and methods from another class

questions.question: What will be printed?
What is encapsulation in OOP?
answers: Bundling data and methods that work on that data within a class

questions.question: What is the output?
questions.code:
class Counter:
    count = 0
    
    def __init__(self):
        Counter.count += 1

c1 = Counter()
c2 = Counter()
print(Counter.count)

questions.question: Which term describes a method with the same name in a subclass overriding the parent behavior?
Which statements about inheritance are correct? (Select all that apply)
answers: a class can extend multiple base classes
function overloading does not require inheritance
super() calls the base class initializer
A subclass cannot access base class attributes
